content:
• Tuesday, April 1, 2014
  • MNKD

    MannKind resumes trading; shares +131.6% AH

    • MannKind (NASDAQ:MNKD) investors are quite happy an FDA panel has recommended approving the use of Afrezza to treat both type 1 and type 2 diabetes.
    • Shares have made new 52-week highs.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:18 PM | 56 Comments

  • After hours Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: ENVI +17.6%. MYGN +6.7%. SQNS +6.6%. BRE +4.1%. EGY +3.3%.
    • Top losers, as of 5:15 p.m.: BGCP -7.5%. QCOR -6.5%. MEET -6.0%. TG -5.9%. APOL -5.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:38 PM | 1 Comment
  • ENVI

    Envivio +12.4% AH on Apple TV service deal with European carrier

    • Envivio's (NASDAQ:ENVI) Muse Live video encoders and Halo media processors are powering the delivery of live HD sports channels by an unnamed tier-1 European carrier to Apple TV set-tops.
    • Envivio notes Halo has been designed to support live and on-demand adaptive bitrate compression "for the full range of Apple devices" (among other products), while leveraging existing broadcast infrastructure.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:50 PM | 2 Comments
  • OPTT

    Ocean Power Tech lands A$5M grant for wave power project

    • Ocean Power Technologies (NASDAQ:OPTT) jumped nearly 9% today after receiving A$5M in initial grant funding from the Australian Renewable Energy Agency.
    • The money is earmarked for Victorian Wave Partners, OPTT's 88%-owned subsidiary, and will help finance construction of a planned wave-power station project off the coast of Australia; the grant also requires OPTT to raise outside funding as well as meeting certain performance milestones.
    • Also, OPTT and the U.S. Energy Department terminate an agreement to deploy one of its PowerBuoys off the coast of Oregon because it was unable to obtain financing to cover “a considerable increase in costs."
     
     
     
     
    | 4:36 PM | 1 Comment
  • BXMT

    Blackstone Mortgage with 8M share secondary

    • The underwriter greenshoe is another 1.2M shares. This is 2014's second offering - there was an 8.5M share secondary in January.
    • BXMT -3.2% AH
     
     
     
     
    | 4:36 PM
  • BRE

    Essex closes acquisition of BRE Properties

    • The combined company has an equity market cap of about $11.1B and a total market cap of $16.2B. BRE Properties shareholders have received 0.2971 newly issued shares of Essex (NYSE:ESS) common stock and $7.18 in cash - $58.87 at today's closing price. The cash consideration was adjusted to reflect the authorization of a $5.15 per share special distribution to BRE shareholders.
    • BRE is up 3.7% AH to $63.25. Essex is off 1.5% to $171.40.
    • Essex anticipates the deal with be accretive to core FFO per share of about $0.05-$0.08 annually.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:15 PM
  • NYMT

    New York Mortgage Trust with 13M share secondary

    • The underwriter greenshoe option is for 1.95M shares. Together with the 13M share offering, it could boost the float by about 23%.
    • NYMT -3% AH
     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM | 7 Comments
  • APOL

    Apollo Group beats by $0.09, misses on revenue

    • Apollo Group (NASDAQ:APOL): FQ2 EPS of $0.28 beats by $0.09.
    • Revenue of $679.1M (-18.6% Y/Y) misses by $9.94M.
    • Share -1.7%  AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:04 PM
  • AXE

    Anixter sale said to stall as buyers balk

    • An effort to sell wiring parts maker Anixter International (AXE -5.1%) has stalled as potential buyers reject the company’s price expectations, Bloomberg reports.
    • French electrical-equipment distributor Rexel (OTCPK:RXEEY), earlier considered one of the more likely buyers, apparently decided to pass, and P-E funds Advent and CVC Capital also chose not to bid.
    • AXE reportedly was seeking offers of more than $115/share, while Rexel wasn’t willing to pay more than $110.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM
  • BA

    Buy Boeing on the dip, Sterne Agee says

    • Sterne Agee advises buying Boeing (BA +2.1%) on the recent pullback, as it reiterates its $164 price target for the shares based on very favorable free cash flow over the next several years.
    • With the long-term cash story still intact, Sterne views a 13x-15x multiple range on 2015 estimates as reasonable given peak cash generation is still two years later in 2017; BA historically has been able to support a 10x-12x peak free cash flow multiple during production upcycles, and the firm thinks this will occur again as production ramps through mid decade.
    • BA's ~5,100 aircraft backlog ensures visibility and flexibility within the production skyline that should result in sustained healthy valuation given the longevity of this aerospace cycle, the firm says.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:39 PM | 3 Comments
  • LLTC

    Linear redeeming $845M worth of convertible notes

    • Linear (LLTC +2.5%) is redeeming all of its 3% convertible senior notes due May 2027. $845M worth of aggregate principal is currently outstanding.
    • The analog chipmaker had $1.71B worth of cash/investments as of Dec. 29, and $838M in debt. Shares are making new 52-week highs.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:13 PM
  • GOMO

    Chinese tech stocks, recent IPOs rebound strongly

    • Hit hard on multiple trading days last week, high-beta Chinese Internet and solar stocks are flying higher amid a tech rally.
    • Leading Chinese Internet gainers: GOMO +14.8% (tumbled last week post-earnings). BITA +10.2%. WUBA +8.9%. VIPS +6.4%. SFUN +6.4%. WBAI +6.3%. CCIH +5.9%. ATHM +5.8%.
    • Notable Chinese solar gainers: CSUN +9.7%. JKS +8.9%. TSL +5.4%. YGE +4.1%. JA Solar is rallying with the help of a bullish Northland coverage launch.
    • Recent IPOs King Digital (KING +4.5%) and Castlight Health (CSLT +16.1%) are among the winners. King remains 16% below its $22.50 IPO price. Castlight is 54% above its $16 IPO price, but well below a post-IPO high of $41.95.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:52 PM | 2 Comments
  • LDK

    LDK Solar begins trading on pink sheets

    • A day after being delisted by the NYSE, and four days after announcing a debt restructuring deal, LDK Solar (NYSE:LDK) has begun trading on the pink sheets under the symbol LDKSY.
    • Shares are currently changing hands at $0.40, 60% below their last NYSE trade of $1.01, which took place on Feb. 21. They opened for trading at a mere $0.10 before moving higher.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:12 PM | 5 Comments
  • ACAS

    American Capital boosts energy team

    • American Capital (ACAS +0.4%) Energy & Infrastructure has appointed Robert Wholey as Managing Director. He comes over after nine years at Highstar Capital and prior to that at UBS' Global Energy Group.
    • Still reverberating is yesterday's announcement of a suspension in dividends while the company considers strategic moves, one of them maybe being the spinoff of the American Capital Asset Management a la NorthStar Realty Finance.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:53 PM | 1 Comment
  • SSYS

    Stratasys rallies on bullish UBS launch; 3D Systems started at Neutral

    • UBS' Steve Milunovich has launched coverage on Stratasys (SSYS +3.9%) with a Buy and $125 PT, and rival 3D Systems (DDD +0.4%) with a Neutral and $62 PT.
    • Milunovich prefers Stratasys on account of "better execution, a narrower focus, and immediate upside potential from MakerBot." He sees MakerBot, which accounted for 16% of Stratasys' Q4 sales, growing 70% this year.
    • At the same time, Milunovich likes 3D Systems' broad product line, M&A efforts (not everyone is a fan), and metal printing exposure. He's also upbeat about its long-term ability to grow aerospace, healthcare, and automotive sales.
    • Citron Research and Credit Suisse argued Stratasys is a better investment than 3D Systems in January.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:46 PM | 5 Comments

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Top 10 Gainers:  PRSC +26%. HPJ +24%. GOMO +19%. OTC:TLOG +17%. ISR +17%. BCPC +17%. CSLT +14%. RCON +13%. DHRM +13%. GST +11%.
    • Top 10 Losers: OTC:ATEA -22%. IDI -19%. YOD -16%. MDCO -15%. JGW -15%. OTC:CDTI -14%. PRAN -14%. GALT -12%. ALTV -12%. CUI -12%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:46 PM
  • BEE

    Strategic Hotels cuts guidance after deals

    • Comparable FY14 EBITDA is expected at $210M-$230M vs. $220M-$240M previously. Comparable FFO per share of $0.50-$0.60 vs. $0.53-$0.63 previously. The company blames the timing and seasonality of the two hotels bought and sold. Other metrics - RevPAR growth of 5-7% and Total RevPAR in the range of 4.5-6.5% for same store and total U.S. hotel portfolios is reaffirmed.
    • Sold is the Marriott London Grosvenor Square hotel for $207.7M which finalizes Strategic Hotels' (BEE -1.4%) exit from Europe. Purchased is the remaining 50% interest in the Fairmont Scottsdale Princess for about $90.6M.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:33 PM
  • KUTV

    Ku6 soars; parent Shanda selling 41% stake

    • Shanda Media, which owns 70.5% of Ku6 (KUTV +57.6%), is selling a 41% stake to Xu Xudong, the founder/controlling shareholder of Chinese social networking/messaging platform iSpeak.
    • The purchase price will be "determined based on the lower of the market price of the Company’s ADSs during the seven consecutive business days immediately prior to the closing of the Transaction and the closing price of the Company’s ADSs on the closing date."
    • Notably, Xu will be paying for the shares using a loan from Shanda that will be "secured by a pledge of all the Company’s shares" he owns. The deal is expected to close by April 30.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:24 PM
  • PANW

    Palo Alto rallies as Street praises analyst day

    • "We walked into Palo Alto Networks' (PANW +3.6%) analyst day positive on the consolidation opportunity in network security. We walk out thinking Palo Alto Networks has a very real shot at making the expansion into the $4B [endpoint security] market work," writes Morgan Stanley's Keith Weiss, reiterating an Overweight and $90 PT.
    • Weiss, who thinks Palo Alto's multiples still don't properly reflect its growth, says the next-gen firewall vendor "remains a top pick in software." His note comes a week after Palo Alto announced it's buying endpoint cybersecurity startup Cyvera for $200M.
    • In its analyst day slides (.pdf), Palo Alto estimated its total addressable market will grow to $19.5B in 2017 from $15.8B in 2014.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:06 PM | 2 Comments
  • MDCO

    No infringement on Angiomax

    • Shares of The Medicines Company (MDCO -14.7%) drop after a Delaware court finds that Hospira's (HSP +1.6%) aNDA for a generic bivalirudin does not infringe on Angiomax patents '727 and '343.
    • The court has yet to enter a final judgement. An appeal needs to be filed within 30 days of the entry.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:57 AM
  • KIOR

    KiOR +50% after Khosla pledges financing up to $25M

    • KiOR (KIOR +49.8%) shares surge after the renewable fuels company secures up to $25M in financing from billionaire backer Vinod Khosla's KFT Trust.
    • KIOR had said it would be unable to fund its operations and meet its obligations if a deal was not finalized by April 1.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:22 AM | 5 Comments
  • JGWEQ

    JGWPT tumbles amid earnings and CFPB probe

    • In its 10-K, JGWPT (JGW -9.6%) discloses the March receipt of a Civil Investigative Demand from the CFPB.
    • As for earnings, total receivables purchases of $260.5M fell 6.6% from a year ago. Company earned $0.04 for every dollar of TRB.
    • Revenues of $106.6M fell 15.5% from a year ago, thanks to those lower TRB purchases and higher interest rates.
    • Debt issuance takes term loan interest expense up to $13.5M from $3.4M a year ago. Late in quarter, company repaid $123M of term loan - bringing outstanding balance down to $434.2M - and brought its interest rate down by about 200 basis points. Annual savings from the moves are expected to be about $20M.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:13 AM
  • LAD

    Auto-related stocks higher after demand in U.S. holds up

    • Automobile industry stocks are on the rise as the early batch of reports on U.S. sales beat expectations on broad strength.
    • Advancers: Lithia Motors (NYSE:LAD) +2.1%, Asbury Automotive (NYSE:ABG) +2.3%, Sonic Automotive (NYSE:SAH) +2.2%, America's Car-Mart (NASDAQ:CRMT) +1.4%, CarMax (NYSE:KMX) +1.5%, AutoNation (NYSE:AN) +1.5%, Pep Boys (NYSE:PBY-OLD) +2.2%, O'Reilly Automotive (NASDAQ:ORLY) +1.7%, Advance Auto Parts (NYSE:AAP) +0.9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:50 AM
  • SQNS

    Sequans gains after announcing Chinese 4G design wins

    • Chinese OEMs Datang and DareGlobal will be supplying 4G TD-LTE devices to China Telecom in Q2 that feature Sequans' (SQNS +4.6%) Mont Blanc TD-LTE platform (includes a baseband processor,, transceiver, and software stack).
    • Both devices are single-mode, which means they won't work with China Telecom's 2G and 3G networks. Sequans faces Chinese 4G baseband competition from market leader Qualcomm, as well as MediaTek, Spreadtrum, and Marvell.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:39 AM
  • UAL

    United Continental higher after upgrade

    • United Continental (UAL +4%) trades higher after UBS upgrades the company to a Buy rating with a $50 price target.
    • The investment firm sees accelerating sales growth for United in Q2.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:38 AM | 1 Comment
  • BHP

    Streamlining BHP Billiton easier said than done, analysts say

    • BHP Billiton (BHP +1.9%) opens higher on news it is considering simplifying its portfolio of assets to focus on its four key commodities - iron ore, copper, coking coal and oil - but Heard on the Street's Helen Thomas advises investors to treat suggestions of a lofty valuation with caution.
    • To hit the A$20B number being talked about would require BHP's non-core assets such as thermal coal, aluminumto be valued at a premium of ~20% to BHP itself, which would require a bullish view on beaten-down commodities such as aluminum; these markets face structural issues of excess supply.
    • There are pros and cons to all of BHP's options: A spinoff of its unloved assets could create a tax liability for current shareholders, an offer of BHP’s unwanted assets in an IPO isn't exactly the most enticing pitch, and an asset sale could prove almost as time-consuming as continuing to run the assets.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:25 AM | 2 Comments
  • MXWL

    Maxwell jumps (again) on bullish Piper note

    • Four weeks after Maxwell (MXWL +8.4%) shot higher in response to a Piper PT hike (to $21) accompanied by speculation about a possible Tesla design win, shares have jumped in response to fresh commentary from the firm.
    • Maxwell sold off in late March amid a general rout in momentum stocks, but remains up 79% YTD. 12% of the float was shorted as of March 14.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:15 AM

  • ISM heating up along with the weather

    • March's gain to 53.7 from 53.2 prior is led by a 7.7 point jump in Production to 55.9. New Orders edged up to 55.1 from 54.5. Supplier Deliveries fell to 54.0 from 58.5 (means times are getting faster). Employment slipped to its lowest level since June, 51.1. Prices 59.0 vs. 60.0. Backlogs 57.5 vs. 52.0.
    • "Business beginning to heat up along with the weather," is one respondent comment.
    • Full report
    • Treasury prices slip a bit further on the print, TLT -0.7%, and the 10-year yield higher by 3 basis points to 2.76%.
    • ETFs: TBT, TLT, TMV, TBF, EDV, TTT, TMF, SBND, ZROZ, TLH, DLBS, VGLT, UBT, TLO, LBND, TYBS, TENZ, DLBL
     
     
     
     
    | 10:11 AM | 1 Comment
  • NVDA

    Tech ratings changes: Nvidia, InvenSense, Rubicon, JA Solar, Tableau

    • Nvidia (NVDA +3.4%) has been upgraded to Outperform by JMP. The company made a flurry of product announcements last week.
    • InvenSense (INVN -2.2%) has been cut to Market Perform by Oppenheimer. A Galaxy S5 teardown recently turned up a 6-axis InvenSense motion sensor.
    • Rubicon (RBCN +10%) has been upgraded to Overweight by JPMorgan.
    • JA Solar (JASO +5.2%) has been started at Outperform by Northland.
    • Tablueau (DATA +1.4%) has been upgraded to Outperform by Baird.
    • Informatica (INFA +4.2%) has been upgraded to Overweight by Barclays.
    • MagnaChip (MX -2.5%) has been cut to Neutral by Chardan Capital following Friday's restatement/CFO news. UBS downgraded shares to Sell yesterday.
    • Extreme Networks (EXTR +6%) has been started at Buy by Wunderlich. The company recently launched several new software products, as well as 100-gig Ethernet blade for its switches.
    • Coupons.com (COUP -2.2%) has received a bullish rating from BofA/Merrill, and neutral ones from Goldman and RBC, on underwriter coverage day.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:40 AM
  • ISR

    Isoray expects five positive presentations at major conference

    • Isoray (NYSEMKT:ISR) shares jump 20% after it says that five papers will be presented at the annual meeting of the American Brachytherapy Society that the company expects will extoll the virtues of its Cesium-131 internal radiation therapy treatment.
    • Isoray "believes that all studies will show exceptional results realized in all areas of the body where Cesium-131, or the physics associated with Cesium-131, was used." (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:37 AM
  • F

    Ford March U.S. sales

    • Ford (NYSE:F) unit sales +3.4% to 194K to eclipse the consensus estimate of analysts for a 1.1% gain.
    • Sales for the Fusion model were up 9% to 32,963 to set an all-time record for March.
    • Shares of Ford (F) are up 1.7% off the stronger-than-expected report.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:35 AM | 12 Comments
  • DRTX

    Durata shares jump following positive FDA AdComm meeting

    • Durata Therapeutics (NASDAQ:DRTX) soars 9.5% premarket after an FDA advisory panel unanimously recommended approval of the company's Dalvance antibiotic for acute bacterial skin conditions.
    • "It's a highly effective drug, as demonstrated in the trial," said Thomas Moore, a clinical professor of medicine at the University of Kansas, who was on the panel.
    • The committee also voted to recommend the authorization of Cubist Pharmaceuticals' Sivextro, another antibiotic for skin problems.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:23 AM

  • Premarket Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: ISR +20%. ISRG +9%. DRTX +9%. SQNS +8%.
    • Losers: MDCO -16%. OTC:CDTI -13%. YOD -12%. BIOF -12%. ARTX -9%. MDR -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:14 AM | 1 Comment
  • ISRG

    FDA authorizes Intuitive's latest da Vinci system

    • The FDA has approved Intuitive Surgical's (NASDAQ:ISRG) da Vinci Xi Surgical System, which the company says "has broader capabilities than prior generations" of the device.
    • "It can be used across a wide spectrum of minimally invasive surgical procedures and has been optimized for complex, multi-quadrant surgeries," Intuitive says.
    • The FDA's authorization comes amid reports of adverse events involving previous versions of the da Vanci and scores of lawsuits.
    • Shares are +9.8%. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:09 AM | 6 Comments
  • CDTI

    Clean Diesel -10.8% premarket on $6.9M equity raise

    • Clean Diesel Technologies (OTC:CDTI) -10.8% premarket after announcing it is raising ~$6.9M in gross proceeds in an offering of ~2M shares of its common stock and warrants to purchase up to 812K shares of common stock at a combined price of $3.40/share and related warrants.
    • CDTI plans to use the proceeds from the offering for general corporate purposes, including working capital, G&A expenses, capital expenditures and implementation of strategic priorities.
    • CDTI had closed Monday down 10% from Friday, hurt by the company's report of another net loss for its latest Q4 despite higher revenue and gross margin.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:07 AM
  • CLNE

    Clean Energy Fuels opens two more LNG fueling stations, shares +10.7%

    • Clean Energy Fuels (NASDAQ:CLNE) +10.7% premarket on news it has opened two more America's Natural Gas Highway stations, one in Texas and one in Oklahoma, to serve UPS' growing heavy-duty truck fleet that runs of liquefied natural gas.
    • Additional truck fueling agreements were announced for fleets fueling across CLNE's nationwide network from Los Angeles to Jacksonville, Fla.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:21 AM | 2 Comments
  • CLI

    Mack-Cali suffers 2nd downgrade in 2 days

    • Mack-Cali Realty (NYSE:CLI) is off 2.1% premarket after KeyBanc's Jordan Sadler pulls his Buy rating and calls the stock a "value-trap." Barclays yesterday cut the stock to Underweight.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:59 AM
  • MNKD

    Mannkind shares halted ahead of AdComm meeting

    • Trading in Mannkind's (NASDAQ:MNKD) shares has been halted ahead of an FDA advisory committee meeting to discuss whether to recommend approving the company's Afrezza inhalable insulin.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:24 AM | 2 Comments
  • MET

    MetLife given boost by BAML

    • MetLife (NYSE:MET) is up 2.3% premarket after being added to BAML's U.S. 1 list of top recommendations.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:20 AM
  • HTH

    SWS Group agrees to sale to Hilltop for about $7.88 per share

    • The boards of both companies have agreed to the deal in which Hilltop Holdings (NYSE:HTH) will buy SWS Group (NYSE:SWS) for cash and stock currently valued at $7.88 per share. SWS owners will receive 0.2496 shares of Hilltop and $1.94 of cash for each share of SWS they own. The deal is expected to close by the end of the year.
    • Hilltop had previously bid $7 for SWS, but was topped in February by Esposito Group's $8 bid. It remains to be seen what SWS owners think about the current deal. The stock is ahead 9.8% in premarket action to $8.21 per share, giving a pretty good idea that $7.88 is not the finally resting place for this sale.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:16 AM | 10 Comments

  • World shares higher following Yellen, PMIs

    • Global equities are mostly higher after Janet Yellen's dovish comments yesterday that the U.S. will need "extraordinary" support for "some time to come" and following PMI data out of China and Europe.
    • However, the Nikkei fell 0.2% after the Tankan survey showed that Japanese companies aren't too happy about their prospects as a sales-tax hike goes into effect today.
    • Hong Kong +1.3%, China +0.7%, India -0.1%.
    • Euro Stoxx 50 +0.3%, London +0.4%, Paris +0.6%, Frankfurt +0.4%, Madrid +0.6%, Milan +0.4%.
    • U.S. stock futures: Dow +0.15%. S&P +0.1%. Nasdaq +0.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:28 AM
